comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content:
a bit of a loose canon
Warhop led the American League in hit batsmen in 1909 (26) and 1910 (18). He led the American League in home runs allowed in 1914 (8) and 1915 (7). His 114 career hit batsmen is a Yankees team record and ranks 37th on the MLB All-Time Hit Batsmen List. He also holds the Yankees single season record for most hit batsmen (26 in 1909).


John Milton Warhop (Chief or Crab)
Bats Right, Throws Right 
Weight 168 lb. 
Debut September 19, 1908 
Final Game August 12, 1915 

not sure why this photo was taken, but this poor fellow has the misfortune to be the first pitcher babe Ruth takes a home run from

 Thursday, May 6, 1915 -- Babe Ruth, the 20-year-old Boston southpaw, hit the first of his record total of 714 regular season major league home runs.

     Ruth's first home run came in the third inning off Jack Warhop, the starting Yankee right-hander.  He was the first batter in the inning and he hit Warhop's first pitch into the second tier of the right-field grandstand.

The ball, a prodigious wallop, landed in Seat 26 of Section 3.
